page.title: 10HATTON GRANGE FARM KEMBERTON
page.content: Hatton Grange estate has been owned by the Kenyon-Slaney family since the 16th century. Part of the estate, Hatton Grange Farm is situated in our area. Hatton Grange estate is 2000 acres, 880 of which are farmed directly. Some land is farmed by tenants. There are 200 acres of woodland, 140 of sugarbeet, 114 of spring barley, 15 of winter barley, 80 of potatoes, 90 of winter wheat, 21 of peas. The rest is grassland. The livestock consists of 145 cows, 100 young calves, 120 beef cattle, mainly heifer cows, and 1 bull. The soil varies in type from sandy to light loam. The average rainfall is 650mm. per year.A reservoir holds 12,000,000 gallons of water which is used mainly to spray the sugarbeet and potatoes.
